newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Woodside values contract at A$100 mln.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Woodside values contract at A$100 mln.

text.p: Woodside Petroleum Pty Ltd on Thursday valued the contract it had awarded to Samsung Heavy Industries Co Ltd for the development of a floating production storage and offloading (FPSO) barge at A$100 million.
"It's in the order of A$100 million," Woodside spokesman Graeme Atherton told Reuters.

Samsung will commence design of a 1.4 million FPSO, for the Laminaria and Corallina oil field project in the Timor Sea, at its fabrication yard on the island of Koji, 40 kilometres from the Korean port of Pusan, Woodside said in a statement.

Fabrication of the barge will begin after the full approval for the development of the fields by regulatory authoritories and the AC/P8 joint venture participants, expected by the end of the year. Production is seen commencing in early 1999, the company said.
The linked Laminaria and Corallina developments have been estimated by Woodside to cost a total of A$900 million.
AC/P8 partners are Woodside with 50 percent and the Broken Hill Proprietary Co Ltd and Royal Dutch/Shell Group with 25 percent each.
